sen.j: 竹内敬持（たけのうち たかもち、正徳 (日本)2年（1712年） - 明和4年12月5日 (旧暦)（1768年1月24日））は、江戸時代中期の神道家、尊王論者。
sen.e: Takamochi TAKENOUCHI (1712 - January 24, 1768) was a Shintoist and imperialist, who lived during the middle of the Edo period.

sen.e: Around 1728, he went up to the capital, and while serving the Tokudaiji family, he learned Confucianism and Suika Shinto (Shinto thoughts advocated by Ansai YAMAZAKI) under Nakayoshi MATSUOKA and Masahide TAMAKI, disciples of Ansai YAMAZAKI.

sen.j: 家塾を開いて、若い公家たちに大義名分を重んじる垂加神道の教義を教授したことから、1758年（宝暦8年）の「宝暦事件」では中心人物として重追放の処分を受けて京都を追放された。
sen.e: He founded a private school, and started teaching the creed of Suika Shinto, which respects the legitimate reason, to young court nobles, but because of this, he was deemed as the central figure of the 'Horeki Incident' and condemned to the most severe punishment in banishment, and he was expelled from Kyoto.

sen.j: その後1767年（明和4年）山県大弐らによる「明和事件」の際、関与を疑われて八丈島に流罪となり、送られる途中に三宅島で病没した。
sen.e: Afterwards, when Daini YAMAGATA and others caused the 'Meiwa Incident,' he was suspected of having been involved in it and sentenced to the banishment to Hachijo-jima Island, but in course of transportation he died of illness in Miyake-jima Island.
